newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - JULY 3.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - JULY 3.

text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:
-- Marta Tocsik, an advisor in the focus of a privatisation scandal over irregular payments, has to pay a tax arrear of 233 million forints.

-- The government would like to expand the rights of the Interest Coordination Council, which is made up of the representatives of employers, employees and the government, a senior labour ministry official said.
-- The government will discuss today a proposal which would provide agricultural producers with loans totalling 50 billion forints.
-- Hungary may have a sugar shortage next year as the sowing area decreased and sugar beat production is not profitable, the National Alliance of Sugar Beat Producers said.
